question: What is Oracle Block Volume Service?

answers.text: A block storage service for attaching high-performance volumes to Oracle Cloud instances

question: Which type of data can be stored on Oracle Block Volumes?

answers.text: Any type of data, including databases and applications

question: What is the maximum size of an Oracle Block Volume?
How is data redundancy achieved in Oracle Block Volume Service?

answers.text: Through replication across multiple data centers

question: What is the purpose of Oracle Block Volume Service in terms of performance?

answers.text: To provide low-latency, high-throughput block storage

question: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) resource does Oracle Block Volume Service enable attachment to?
What is the purpose of the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Console for managing Block Volumes?

answers.text: To manage, create, and attach block volumes

question: How can you increase the size of an existing Oracle Block Volume?

answers.text: By creating a new volume with the desired size
By detaching and reattaching the volume

question: What is the purpose of Oracle Block Volume backups?

answers.text: To provide low-latency, high-throughput block storage
To protect against accidental data loss or corruption

question: Which encryption method is used for data at rest in Oracle Block Volume Service?
What is the purpose of volume performance metrics in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)?

answers.text: To monitor and optimize the performance of block volumes

question: How does Oracle Block Volume Service ensure data durability?

answers.text: By periodically backing up data to tape
By replicating data across multiple data centers

question: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Identity and Access Management (IAM) resource is used to control access to Oracle Block Volume Service?
How does Oracle Block Volume Service provide data encryption in transit?
What is the purpose of the 'Volume Groups' feature in Oracle Block Volume Service?

answers.text: To group multiple volumes to achieve high availability

question: How does Oracle Block Volume Service ensure high availability?

answers.text: By replicating data across multiple fault domains
By periodically backing up data to tape

question: What is the purpose of the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) SDKs for Block Volume Service?

answers.text: To programmatically manage and interact with block volumes

question: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) service is used for centralized logging and monitoring of Oracle Block Volumes?
What is the purpose of the 'Restore Volume' feature in Oracle Block Volume Service?

answers.text: To recover a volume to a previous state

question: How does Oracle Block Volume Service help with data migration?

answers.text: By providing tools for copying data between volumes and regions
By replicating data across multiple fault domains

question: What is the purpose of the 'Volume Tags' feature in Oracle Block Volume Service?

answers.text: To label volumes for easier management and identification

question: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) service provides real-time alerts and notifications for Block Volumes?
What is the purpose of the 'Volume Migration' feature in Oracle Block Volume Service?

answers.text: To move volumes between different storage tiers

question: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) resource is used to define policies for managing Oracle Block Volumes?
What is the purpose of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Object Storage in relation to Oracle Block Volume Service?

answers.text: To provide scalable and secure object storage for data backup

question: How does Oracle Block Volume Service handle data encryption in transit?
What is the purpose of the 'Volume Attachments' feature in Oracle Block Volume Service?

answers.text: To view and manage attachments of block volumes to instances

question: Which Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) resource is used to define access control for Oracle Block Volumes?
What is the purpose of the 'Boot Volumes' feature in Oracle Block Volume Service?

answers.text: To label volumes for easier management and identification

question: Scenario: You are deploying a high-performance database on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) and need dedicated storage with low-latency. Which OCI service would you choose?
Scenario: Your application requires shared file storage for multiple instances. Which OCI service is suitable for this requirement?
Scenario: You need to store large amounts of unstructured data like backups, logs, and multimedia files. Which OCI storage service is designed for this purpose?
Scenario: Your application requires scalable and durable object storage with the ability to create custom metadata. Which OCI service would you choose?
Scenario: You are designing a backup solution that requires infrequently accessed, low-cost storage with a retrieval time of a few hours. Which OCI storage service suits this scenario?
Scenario: Your application requires a high-throughput, low-latency storage solution, and you need to attach volumes to multiple instances. Which OCI service would you use?

Scenario: You are deploying a new application that involves collaborative editing of documents, and you need a file system that can be accessed concurrently by multiple instances. Which OCI service is appropriate for this scenario?
Scenario: Your application requires block-level storage for a high-performance, mission-critical database. You need to ensure data integrity and consistency. Which OCI service would you choose?

Scenario: You are implementing a disaster recovery solution and need to store backups in a cost-effective manner with the ability to retrieve data within minutes. Which OCI storage service meets this requirement?
Scenario: You need to store data that is accessed infrequently and has a long retention period. Cost optimization is a priority. Which OCI storage service is suitable for this scenario?
Scenario: Your application requires shared storage for application binaries and libraries that need to be accessed by multiple instances. Which OCI service is designed for this?
Scenario: You are designing a solution for storing backups and need to ensure data durability, security, and easy retrieval. Which OCI storage service would you choose?

Scenario: Your application requires the ability to quickly provision and attach additional storage to instances. You also need the flexibility to resize volumes. Which OCI service meets this requirement?
